alert.note: Alert for Del Norte Interior (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued November 18 at 3:00AM PST until November 18 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE SMITH RIVER COMPLEX BURN SCAR IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall are possible over the Smith River Complex burn scar. * WHERE...A portion of northwest California, including the following area, Del Norte Interior. * WHEN...From 2 PM PST this afternoon through this evening. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall over the Smith River Complex burn scar is expected up to and during the period of the watch. Residents near the Smith River Complex burn scar should prepare for potential flooding impacts. Be sure to stay up to date with information from local authorities. Heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding of low-lying areas, urbanized street flooding, and debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. Mudslides and falling rocks could also create hazardous driving conditions on highway 199. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - National Weather Service Meteorologists are forecasting heavy rainfall over the Smith River Complex burn scar, which may lead to flash flooding and debris flows. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
